items.title: Marokko swingt mede door n√≥g een fenomenale omhaal naar de achtste finales
items.summary: Marokko is in het nieuwe jaar nog te zien op de Afrika Cup. Het gastland van het toernooi was in de allesbeslissende wedstrijd veel te sterk voor Zambia. Hoogtepunt was een tweede rake omhaal van Ayoub El Kaabi.

items.title: VI Live: Mali en zijn Belgische bondscoach zijn een ronde verder op Afrika Cup
items.summary: Ook maandag wordt er weer gevoetbald in de Afrika Cup. Het Egypte van Mohamed Salah staat tegenover Angola en Marokko treft Zambia. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van maandag in deze VI Live.

items.title: Slegers won CL met Arsenal: 'Iets geflikt wat op voorhand onmogelijk leek'
items.summary: Ren√©e Slegers won dit jaar met de vrouwen van Arsenal de Champions League. In de finale werd het onaantastbaar geachte Barcelona met 1-0 verslagen. Slegers blikt in het VI Kerstnummer terug op misschien wel de meest ondergesneeuwde sportprestatie van 2025.

items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Transfer van Hartman naar Ajax gaat niet door
items.summary: Quilindschy Hartman gaat niet naar Ajax. De linksback werd de voorbije uren veelal aan een overgang van Burnley naar Amsterdam gelinkt, maar dat is van de baan.

items.title: Sources: Denver to sign Oke for NWSL record fee
items.summary: Denver Summit FC has agreed to a transfer with Mexico's Pachuca for defender Ayo Oke for what would be the highest incoming transfer fee for an American player in NWSL history, sources told ESPN.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal 'actively looking' for January deals
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said the club are prepared to ease their injury problems by "actively looking" at signing new players when the transfer window reopens next month.

items.title: Slot frustrated over injuries to Liverpool signings
items.summary: Liverpool have yet to get full value from their huge summer spending spree because of the injuries they have suffered, according to head coach Arne Slot.

items.title: Afcon roundup: South Africa join Egypt in last 16 after win against Zimbabwe
items.summary: South Africa 3-2 Zimbabwe | Egypt 0-0 Angola Angola face wait to qualify but Zimbabwe out Oswin Appollis scored a penalty in the final 10 minutes to hand South Africa a 3-2 victory over Zimbabwe in Marrakech on Monday and seal second spot in Group B at the Africa Cup of Nations, dumping their southern African rivals out of the tournament. South Africa finish with six points in the group, one behind Egypt. Both those advance to the last 16 as Angola, on two points, finish in third and face an anxious wait to see if that is enough as one of the four best third-placed sides. Continue reading...

items.title: Forest ask for VAR audio after Man City defeat
items.summary: Nottingham Forest have asked to hear the VAR audio as they consider making an official complaint following the Premier League defeat by Manchester City.

items.title: Goals of the year 2025: dazzling skills, acrobatics and sublime strikes
items.summary: From jaw-dropping tricks to scorpion kicks, flicks, solo efforts and more ‚Äì enjoy our pick of 2025‚Äôs best goals The very definition of top bins: James Edmondson pops one right in the stanchion at Slough Town to help Macclesfield Town into the third round of the FA Cup. items.title: Arsenal wil revanche na vorige duel met Aston Villa dat 'wreed einde' had
items.summary: Mikel Arteta heeft wel een idee hoe hij Aston Villa dinsdag w√©l kan verslaan met Arsenal. De Spaanse manager heeft geleerd van wat er eerder deze maand gebeurde.

items.title: Hull ahead at Boro; Leicester, Wrexham, Sheff Utd lead - EFL LIVE!
Sutton's predictions v singer-songwriter & Sunderland fan Tom A Smith
items.summary: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on singer-songwriter and Sunderland fan Tom A Smith - and AI - with his predictions for this week's Premier League fixtures.

items.title: Manby continues dream run at Ally Pally while Aspinall suffers exit
items.summary: Charlie Manby reached the last 16 of the World Darts Championship on debut after defeating 'Rapid' Ricky Evans 4-2 as crowd-favourite Nathan Aspinall was knocked out.

items.title: Van de Ven lifts lid on Spurs' hectic 2025
items.summary: It has been a topsy-turvy year at Tottenham Hotspur, with Micky van de Ven lifting the lid on a memorable but ever-changing year at Spurs.

items.title: Keep, dump or extend: What transfers should Man United make in January?
items.summary: The January transfer window opens this week, and big clubs like Man United have plenty of big decisions to make -- including with Ruben Amorim himself.

items.title: Can 'tactical genius' Emery get the better of Arteta again in key title race clash?
items.summary: Unai Emery says going to Arsenal on Tuesday night is Aston Villa's "biggest challenge" yet - but Mikel Arteta may be feeling the same way about his visitors at the Emirates.

items.title: Bournemouth target Brennan Johnson as potential Semenyo replacement
items.summary: Spurs open to doing business for ¬£47.5m forward Semenyo primed to join Manchester City in ¬£65m deal Bournemouth have identified Tottenham‚Äôs Brennan Johnson as a potential replacement for Antoine Semenyo, who is primed to join Manchester City in a deal worth ¬£65m. City are accelerating talks with Semenyo‚Äôs camp and are at the front of the queue to trigger the Ghana winger‚Äôs release clause, inserted last summer when Semenyo extended his contract at Bournemouth.
